ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to deeply analyze and critique research papers and studies on foreign aid and political science in general.

I learned about how to read a paper and identify good social science research. The course also introduced me to topics in foreign aid research, though the main focus was on quantitative research in general.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The small class size was good for discussion. The articles we read were challenging and interesting. The only thing that can be an improvement is letting the students know what exactly we're reading at least a week before the class.

The course is taught like a graduate course, which means it is a seminar in which the teacher and students discuss a few papers each week. The papers that we read were almost all really interesting and insightful. Professor Aronow is good at explaining which parts of the papers are important and which can be ignored. He gets off topic at times, but trust me, that is one the best parts of the class. The only thing that can be improved is that the professor could upload the papers in a more timely manner.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it gives skills beyond learning the material. I feel much more confident in writing research papers and understanding and analyzing other people's work.
Take it. Aronow is the best at what he does.

Yes, this course is really chill and you learn a lot. Additionally, Professor Aronow is always available during office hours to discuss pretty much anything. The research project at the end is open-ended and you can choose to study pretty much anything.
